meanings.definition: Having some ability to read and write, but not fully literate.
meanings.sent1: She is semiliterate and can read simple sentences.
meanings.sent2: The semiliterate man struggled to fill out the form.
meanings.sent3: The semiliterate student thought 'cat' spelled backwards was 'tac'.
meanings.sent4: His semiliterate understanding of the instructions led to confusion.
meanings.sent5: The semiliterate child traced the letters with his finger to learn.

meanings.definition: A person who is partially literate.
meanings.sent1: The semiliterate in the village helps others with basic reading.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed being the only semiliterate in the class.
meanings.sent3: The semiliterate won the spelling bee by guessing all the words.
meanings.sent4: He was a semiliterate in a world of scholars.
meanings.sent5: The semiliterate's determination to learn inspired everyone around.
